info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 6:46PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lyman County through 815 PM CDT... At 745 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Counselor Creek Boat Access Area, or near Fort Thompson, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Lyman County, including the following locations... southeastern Lower Brule Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Aberdeen.
